intro: Mesospinidium ecuadorense, commonly known as the Ecuadorian mesospinidium, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the high-altitude conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
